echo.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if a sound echoes, you hear it again because it was made near something such as a wall or hill
echo.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The sound of an engine echoed back from the thick forest.
He could hear eerie noises echoing through the corridors.
echo.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if a place echoes, it is filled with sounds that are repeated or are similar to each other
echo.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The house echoed with the sound of children’s voices.
echo.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to repeat what someone else has just said
echo.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: ‘You bet, ’ she said, echoing his words.
echo.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to repeat an idea or opinion because you agree with it
echo.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The article simply echoed the NRA’s arguments against gun control.
echo.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
echo.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
echo.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: something that is very similar to something that has happened or been said before
echo.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: This idea finds an echo in many African countries.
The article contains echoes of an earlier report.
